TrajGen¶

class gamegine.analysis.trajectory.lib.TrajGen.MinimizationStrategy[source]¶

Bases: Enum

Enum used to define the minimization strategy for a trajectory optimization problem.

Parameters:

  • TIME – Minimize the time taken to complete the trajectory.

  • DISTANCE – Minimize the distance traveled in the trajectory.

DISTANCE = 1¶
TIME = 0¶
class gamegine.analysis.trajectory.lib.TrajGen.SolverConfig[source]¶

Bases: object

Dataclass used to store configuration information for a trajectory optimization solver. This decides how accurately the solver attempts to solve the problem, in addition to allowing for a time limit on the solver.

Parameters:

  • solution_tolerance (float) – The tolerance of the solution.

  • max_iterations (int) – The maximum number of iterations the solver will run.

  • timeout (float) – The maximum time the solver will run before stopping.

__init__(solution_tolerance=1e-06, max_iterations=1000, timeout=100.0)¶
Parameters:

  • solution_tolerance (float)

  • max_iterations (int)

  • timeout (float)

Return type:

None

max_iterations: int = 1000¶
solution_tolerance: float = 1e-06¶
timeout: float = 100.0¶

Bases: TrajectoryRobotConstraints

Parameters:

  • point_vars (SwervePointVariables) – The state variables at all discrete points in the trajectory.

  • point_vars (SwervePointVariables)

Parameters:

robot_constraints (SwerveRobotConstraints) – The constraints of the robot.

class gamegine.analysis.trajectory.lib.TrajGen.TrajectoryBuilderConfig[source]¶

Bases: object

Dataclass used to store configuration information for a trajectory optimization problem.

Parameters:

  • trajectory_resolution (SpatialMeasurement) – The resolution of the trajectory.

  • stretch_factor (float) – Factor which controls how much the trajectory can “stretch” from its initial path.

  • min_spacing (SpatialMeasurement) – The minimum spacing between points in the trajectory, can help space out points and keep them from clumping up.

  • apply_kinematic_constraints (bool) – Whether to apply kinematic constraints to the trajectory.

  • minimization_strategy (MinimizationStrategy) – The minimization strategy for the trajectory.

__init__(trajectory_resolution=10.0 cm, stretch_factor=1.1, min_spacing=1.0 cm, apply_kinematic_constraints=True, minimization_strategy=MinimizationStrategy.TIME)¶
Parameters:

  • trajectory_resolution (SpatialMeasurement)

  • stretch_factor (float)

  • min_spacing (SpatialMeasurement)

  • apply_kinematic_constraints (bool)

  • minimization_strategy (MinimizationStrategy)

Return type:

None

apply_kinematic_constraints: bool = True¶
min_spacing: SpatialMeasurement = 1.0 cm¶
minimization_strategy: MinimizationStrategy = 0¶
stretch_factor: float = 1.1¶
trajectory_resolution: SpatialMeasurement = 10.0 cm¶

class gamegine.analysis.trajectory.lib.problemVariables.PointVariables[source]¶

Bases: object

Dataclass used to store the state variables at all discrete points in a trajectory.

Parameters:

  • POS_X (list containing Sleipnir decision variables) – The x position of the robot.

  • POS_Y (list containing Sleipnir decision variables) – The y position of the robot.

  • VEL_X (list containing Sleipnir decision variables) – The x velocity of the robot.

  • VEL_Y (list containing Sleipnir decision variables) – The y velocity of the robot.

  • ACCEL_X (list containing Sleipnir decision variables) – The x acceleration of the robot.

  • ACCEL_Y (list containing Sleipnir decision variables) – The y acceleration of the robot.

  • THETA (list containing Sleipnir decision variables) – The angle of the robot.

  • OMEGA (list containing Sleipnir decision variables) – The angular velocity of the robot.

  • ALPHA (list containing Sleipnir decision variables) – The angular acceleration of the robot.

  • DT (list containing Sleipnir decision variables) – The time step between each point.

ACCEL_X: list¶
ACCEL_Y: list¶
ALPHA: list¶
DT: list¶
OMEGA: list¶

POS_Y: list¶

class gamegine.analysis.trajectory.lib.problemVariables.SwervePointVariables[source]¶

Bases: PointVariables

Dataclass used to store the state variables at all discrete points in a swerve drive trajectory.

Parameters:

  • POS_X (list containing Sleipnir decision variables) – The x position of the robot.

  • POS_Y (list containing Sleipnir decision variables) – The y position of the robot.

  • VEL_X (list containing Sleipnir decision variables) – The x velocity of the robot.

  • VEL_Y (list containing Sleipnir decision variables) – The y velocity of the robot.

  • ACCEL_X (list containing Sleipnir decision variables) – The x acceleration of the robot.

  • ACCEL_Y (list containing Sleipnir decision variables) – The y acceleration of the robot.

  • THETA (list containing Sleipnir decision variables) – The angle of the robot.

  • OMEGA (list containing Sleipnir decision variables) – The angular velocity of the robot.

  • ALPHA (list containing Sleipnir decision variables) – The angular acceleration of the robot.

  • DT (list containing Sleipnir decision variables) – The time step between each point.

  • TL (ModuleVariables) – The state variables for the top left swerve module.

  • TR (ModuleVariables) – The state variables for the top right swerve module.

  • BL (ModuleVariables) – The state variables for the bottom left swerve module.

  • BR (:class:`ModuleVariables) – The state variables for the bottom right swerve module.

BL: ModuleVariables¶
BR: ModuleVariables¶
TL: ModuleVariables¶
TR: ModuleVariables¶

  • POS_Y (list)

  • VEL_X (list)

  • VEL_Y (list)

  • ACCEL_X (list)

  • ACCEL_Y (list)

  • THETA (list)

  • OMEGA (list)

  • ALPHA (list)

class gamegine.analysis.trajectory.lib.trajectoryStates.TrajectoryState[source]¶

Bases: object

Stores individual points along a trajectory, including position, velocity, acceleration, and angular velocity.

Parameters:

  • x (SpatialMeasurement) – The x position of the robot.

  • y (SpatialMeasurement) – The y position of the robot.

  • vel_y (Velocity) – The y velocity of the robot.

  • acc_y (Velocity) – The y acceleration of the robot.

  • alpha (Alpha) – The angular acceleration of the robot.

class gamegine.analysis.trajectory.lib.constraints.avoidance.SafeCorridor[source]¶

Bases: Rectangle

Class for representing a safe corridor for the robot to travel through. Wraps around a rectangle to provide a safe corridor for the robot to travel through.

draw(render_scale)[source]¶

Draws the boundary, used by the Renderer to draw the boundary.

Parameters:

render_scale (SpatialMeasurement) – The scale to render the boundary at.

Parameters:

obstacles (List[DiscreteBoundary]) – The obstacles that the robot must avoid.

Returns:

The constraint function that ensures the robot’s path is within a safe corridor.

Callable[[Problem, PointVariables], None]

gamegine.analysis.trajectory.lib.constraints.constraints.VelocityMagnitudeEquals(velocity)[source]¶

Constraint for setting the magnitude of the velocity vector to a specific value.

Parameters:

velocity (Velocity) – The desired velocity magnitude.

Returns:

The constraint function.

Return type:

Callable[[Problem, PointVariables, int], None]

gamegine.analysis.trajectory.lib.constraints.kinematics.OmegaKinematicsConstraint(problem, point_variables)[source]¶

A constraint that enforces the kinematic equation for angular velocity, w = u + at.

Parameters:

  • problem (Problem) – The optimization problem.

  • point_variables (PointVariables) – The variables for the points in the trajectory.

gamegine.analysis.trajectory.lib.constraints.kinematics.PositionKinematicsConstraint(problem, point_variables)[source]¶

A constraint that enforces the kinematic equation for position, s = ut + 0.5at^2.

Parameters:

  • problem (Problem) – The optimization problem.

  • point_variables (PointVariables) – The variables for the points in the trajectory.

gamegine.analysis.trajectory.lib.constraints.kinematics.ThetaKinematicsConstraint(problem, point_variables)[source]¶

A constraint that enforces the kinematic equation for angular position, theta = omega*t + 0.5*alpha*t^2.

Parameters:

  • problem (Problem) – The optimization problem.

  • point_variables (PointVariables) – The variables for the points in the trajectory.

Returns:

The constraint function.

Return type:

Callable[[Problem, PointVariables], None]

A constraint that enforces the kinematic equation for velocity, v = u + at.

Parameters:

  • problem (Problem) – The optimization problem.

  • point_variables (PointVariables) – The variables for the points in the trajectory.
